simsim.core
Class TcpChannel

java.lang.Object
  simsim.core.TcpChannel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Displayable
public class TcpChannel
extends java.lang.Object
implements Displayable

This class implements blocking network operations, allowing a message to be sent and replied-to within a channel. A TcpChannel is a connection between two endpoints, established when a blocking send operation is performed on a endpoint (tcpSend). At the receiving node, the message handler is called to get the message processed. A reference to the channel is passed along with the message, allowing the receiving node to know the origin of the message and to send a reply via the channel. The node that established the connection will block until the read operation is possible. Currently, the channel only supports a single reply. It does not allow for a continuous dialogue.

Author:
SÃ©rgio Duarte (smd@di.fct.unl.pt)
